original: Dhammapaccanīyānuloma (4), Tikadukapaṭṭhānapāḷi (4)🔽22.26. Sanidassanattika, Hetuduka🔽Nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca anidassanaappaṭigho hetu dhammo
analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma tika duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi  sani dassana ttika hetu duka  na sa nidassana sa ppaṭigham na hetum dhammam paṭicca anidassana appaṭighaḥ hetu dhammo
translated: The reverse order of the law of conditionality, The Paṭṭhāna text in triplets and couplets🔽With the visible, with cause🔽With a visible object and impinging, with a cause, a condition is a visible object and impinging, with a cause, a state.

original: uppajjati hetupaccayā. Naanidassanasappaṭighaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca anidassanaappaṭigho🔽hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ nahetuñca naanidassanasappaṭighaṁ
analyzed: uppajjati hetu paccayā na anidassana sappaṭigham na hetum dhammam paṭicca anidassana appaṭighaḥ  hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na sa nidassana sa paṭigham na hetuñca na a nidassana sa paṭigha
translated: With a non-visible object and impinging, with a cause, a condition is a non-visible object and impinging, with a cause, a state.

original: nahetuñca dhammaṁ paṭicca anidassanaappaṭigho hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: na hetuñca dhammam paṭicca anidassana appaṭighaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a visible object and impinging, with a cause, and with a non-visible object and impinging, with a cause, a condition is a non-visible object and impinging, with a cause, a state.

original: (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ nanahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca sanidassanasappaṭigho nahetu dhammo
analyzed: saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi  na sa nidassana sa paṭigham na na hetum dhammam paṭicca sa nidassana sa paṭighaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ
translated: (In brief.) In the section on cause there are three … In the section on the unspecific there are three.🔽With a visible object and impinging, without a cause, a condition is a visible object and impinging, without a cause, a state.

original: uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ nanahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca anidassanasappaṭigho
analyzed: uppajjati hetu paccayā na sa nidassana sa paṭigham na na hetum dhammam paṭicca anidassana sa paṭighaḥ
translated: With a visible object and impinging, without a cause, a condition is a non-visible object and impinging, without a cause, a state.

original: nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Nahetu nanahetu ovattā, tīṇi mūlāni, ekavīsati
analyzed: na hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na hetu na na hetu ovattā tīṇi mūlāni ekavīsati
translated: A state without cause arises with cause condition. (Without cause and with cause, three roots, twenty-one

original: pañhā kātabbā.) Hetuyā ekavīsa, ārammaṇe tīṇi …pe… avigate ekavīsa.
analyzed: pañhā kātabbā hetuyā ekavīsa ārammaṇe tīṇi pe avigate ekavīsa
translated: questions are to be asked.) Twenty-one in the case of cause, three in the case of object … three in the case of non-hindrance.
